result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio K Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid to Laura D. as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with any co-actor, victim/witness or their residences.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 10/8/2015 Sentencing
State's position regarding sentence credit
From Court to State requesting State's position on sentence credit ordered for count 5.
Filed by DOC requesting Court review the sentence credit ordered on the JOC for count 5.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Antonio K Bell in court, in custody, with attorney Robert J. Penegor.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to counts 3, 4 and 5. Counts 1, 2, 6, 7, and 8 are dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:  

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following: Counts 3 and 4

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

4 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 164 days as to count 3)
  -  2 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 1/2  YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;  Sentences to run consecutive

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with:  any co-actor, victim/witness or their residences
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

RESTITUTION:  $105.00 to Laura D. (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 each  (ct.3) $268.00 (ct.4) (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DRGOD SURCHARGE: $10.00 each (ct.3) and (ct.4) 

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 each (ct.3) and (ct.4)  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


Count 5:

9 months county jail to run concurrent
Court Costs of $243.00 and $10.00 DRGOD
